charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
pageSummary: 40 day Fitness Challenge To Raise Awareness Cancer because My dad just got the all clear but not everyone doe
pageSummaryWhat: 40 day Fitness Challenge To Raise Awareness Cancer
pageSummaryWhy: My dad just got the all clear but not everyone doe
story:
As Most Of You Know My Wee Dad Has Just Beaten Cancer & Got The All Clear 🙏 It Was A Terrible Thing To Watch My Dad Go Through & Was One Of The Most Emotional Draining Years! I Cant Thank The NHS & Everyone At MacMilliam Cancer Support For All There Support, Help & Advice! When Ever We Needed It! What A Difference This Made To My Dad & My Family! 💚 Don't Know How We Would Have Coped Otherwise 💚🙏💚

So As A Way Of Saying Thank You & Showing My Appreciation, I've Decided To Do A 40 Day Fitness Challenge & Help Raise Awareness & Well Needed Funds For The MacMillian Cancer Support Team 💚

MacMillian Offer Advice About Difference Types Of Cancer, Including Risk Factors Symptoms, Tests & Treatments! As Well As Offering Advice On Different Tests & Scans, Treatments Drugs & Helping With Treatment Decisions! Something l Found An Absolute Lifeline In Supporting Me To Support My Dad. My Dad Couldn't Really Make Decisions Or Progress Any Information He Was Given! As He Was In Shock & Basically Scared For His Life! Having MacMillian Cancer Support There Basically 24/7 Was Massive For Me & Meant I Could Get The Advice I Needed To Support My Dad And Also Help Put His Mind At Ease During One Of The Worst & Most Stressful Times 😔💚

Sadly Cancer Is Still Affecting Millions & Hasn't Stopped Because Of This Pandemic & Not Everyone Is As Fortunate As My Dad! My Friend Natalie Who I Am Doing The 40 Day Fitness Challenge With, Her Wee Mum Has Liver Cancer 😔 And Is Still Fighting It & There Are Millions In The Same Position! So We Are Trying To Rasie Awareness & As Much Money As Possible To Help MacMillian Reach Out & Support Even More Cancer Patients & There Families 💚

We Know Times Are Tough For Everyone Just Now! If Your Able To And Can Spare A Few Pounds, Please Check Out The Page Below & Help This Amazing Cause! 💚

#40Day #FitnessChallenge﻿﻿ #Raising #Awareness #Funds 💷 #MacMillianCancerSupport 💚🙏💚 

 At Macmillan, we give people with cancer everything we’ve got. If you’re diagnosed, your worries are our worries. We’re doing whatever it takes. But without your help we can’t support everyone who needs us.Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.

pageSummary: I am walking backwards 100 miles because I have seen first hand the wonderful work they do
pageSummaryWhy: I have seen first hand the wonderful work they do
story:
Thank you all for your time to visit this page to donate, it means so much to me and so far i have raised very close to £60,000 now. None of my challenges are normal, I get to invent my own challenges every year and have completed 15 challenges now. Your donations go a long way to help people living with cancer and many thanks once again, 

I start walking at Braunston Marina on 7th July 2021 and finish at Macmillan's head office on 16th July 2021 and will also have a live tracker on the website , please visit www.willthemadfoolmakeit.co.uk

Stuart

pageSummary: Our beloved Stevie passed away on 10th February 21 because they offered Stevie fantastic support!
pageSummaryWhat: Our beloved Stevie passed away on 10th February 21
story:
Stevie sadly passed away after a short battle with Pancreatic Cancer on Wednesday 10th February,

Stevies Funeral will be held on Friday 26th February at 12:40pm at Markeaton Crematorium, Derby. Due to current covid restrictions numbers are limited for the service to celebrate Stevie's life. The Family will be holding an event in the near future, where all will be welcome to commemorate Stevie and her Dad, Len, who sadly passed away in April 2020.

As there will be No Flowers, we are raising funds in Her loving Memory. Stevie had hoped to hold a huge Macmillan Coffee Morning in October 2020 shortly after her diagnosis, due to the current covid crisis she was unable to for fill this wish, where she could bring family and friends together to drink tea and eat lots of cake! She did however manage to run a raffle and raise a spectacular  £1057. 

Macmillan Offered Stevie great support and we know that she would want funds raised in her memory as a lasting legacy.


Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

pageSummaryWhy: they do a fantastic job and help a lot of people!
story:
To help and support the Macmillan charity and all the work they do for cancer research I will be taking part in the David Goggins 4x4x48 Challenge. I hope to raise as much money as possible for a fantastic cause!

The challenge involves running 4 miles, every 4 hours for 48 hours. It will be tough!

I am not an experienced runner, I just run occasionally and haven't done anything like this before. If you would like to join in virtually and support that way, that would be awesome. The event takes place from Friday 5th March (PST). There is more information about the event on the website:

https://www.gogginschallenge.com/

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.

Many thanks,

Tom Watmough

story: As a thank you for taking great care of Fred and for being there. This appeal will see every donation stay in Yorkshire. Macmillan professionals, provide training and resources to existing professionals, provide Grants to help the most financially vulnerable patients and provide expert advice through the Support Line to help people avoid financial difficulties. A significant drop in voluntary income at a time when a growing number of people who need our support in Yorkshire means we need your help like never before.

charity.description:
The nation’s leading first aid charity.
Every year, more than 400,000 people learn how to save a life through our training programmes.
Our volunteers provide first aid in their communities and thanks to them fewer lives will be lost needlessly. 
Raise money. Help save lives. Be the difference.
charity.name: St John Ambulance
eventName: Fundraising for St John Ambulance with Taylor Wessing
pageSummary: For 9 weeks, I am walking jumping and doing planks
pageSummaryWhat: For 9 weeks, I am walking jumping and doing planks
story:
Join Taylor Wessing in raising £20,000 for St John Ambulance to support the health of our communities.

As a firm we have almost 70 teams who between 27 January and 31 March will be trying to virtually walk our way around the globe to raise funds for St Johns Ambulance.  They have played a vital role throughout the coronavirus pandemic, none more so than now with their continued support with the delivery of the COVID-19 vaccine.

Their vaccination volunteers are delivering these vital jabs and taking care of people before and after they receive them.

Please help support this amazing service by making a donation, if you can.

Many Thanks

pageSummary: I am walking to raise  money for a defibrillator because Defibrillators save people’s lives everyday
pageSummaryWhat: I am walking to raise  money for a defibrillator
story:
As a charity with a long history of serving humanity, we are proud of our past, our role in the pandemic and excited about creating a healthier, safer, brighter and more resilient future.

This winter may be our toughest yet and I am helping to bring some community spirit by sharing my sparkle by supporting St John. 

St John volunteers treat and transport thousands of patients each year, and in times of crisis we are England's national health reserve.  

During the pandemic our skilled and highly trained volunteers are working long shifts supporting sick people and their families, in hospitals, in ambulances and at home. We are proud to be working alongside the nations ambulance trusts and in hospitals around the country.

"I enjoy helping people and its what I have been training to do. Its very rewarding personally knowing that my colleagues and I are making a difference to peoples lives when they most need it." 
Tom Willis, volunteer 

Will you support me and help make a difference?
title: Defibrillators save lives it could save yours

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am indoor cycling 150 miles in March because Covid has cut ability to research by half
pageSummaryWhat: I am indoor cycling 150 miles in March
pageSummaryWhy: Covid has cut ability to research by half
story:
In March I have set myself the target of cycling 150 miles on my turbo trainer.  

Covid has delayed people’s treatment, operations and check ups but it has proven what wonderful scientists we have in this country. It has diverted attention and monies, cutting the British heart foundations ability to research by half. We need to get back on track

Thank you

story:
Rest in peace Dad: 24/05/1958 - 03/02/2021

We have set up this page to honour the beloved Clive Daly aka Dan.

Our Dad was sadly taken from us too soon and we appreciate that there are circumstances where people are unable to attend the funeral/donate in person.

Please give as much or as little as you wish, its just a bonus that something positive can come from such a devastating time.

Thank you in advance.

Best wishes from all the family x
title: Donations to the British Heart Foundation on behalf of Clive Daly aka Dan

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be extremely grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks! 😊🤗

story: My Step Challenge is a fun and simple way to raise money for the BHF. With every pound you raise and your support, we will be closer to beating heartbreak forever. I was diagnosed with Right Sided Heart Failure in November 2019, so I'm a survivor since then I've lost 9½st in 7 months and also stopped drinking 1 Year 4 Month 😄💔💪🏻.....

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
eventName: Cienna and Grandads heART attack challenge!
pageSummary: Please support us by sponsorship here if you can!
pageSummaryWhat: Please support us by sponsorship here if you can!
story:
Thanks for visiting our page! 

After personally experiencing the effects a heart attack sadly has on a family, 9 year old Cienna was determined to do something special and try to raise money for the British Heart Foundation !

 Cienna and her grandad are fundraising by taking part in a 14 day art challenge together from the 16th of February, we would be very grateful if as many of our lovely friends and family who are able to would sponsor us.... Thanks so much!

The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK.... every pound helps! 

Please just take a few moments to check out the BHF website for more information on the signs of a heart attack and how to learn how to do cpr for free! 

Check out our updates below to see cienna and Grandads art challenges each day!

story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. My Dad recently had open-heart surgery and is now recovering at home. I am extremely grateful for the amazing work that the surgeons, doctors, and nursing staff at the Cardiac Centre in Blackpool Victoria Hospital did to help my Dad. It's only thanks to supporting from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Sadly we lost Jimmy who passed in his home on January 31st 2021. In his memory his Family would like donations to be made to British Heart Foundation to honour his memory.

He loved attending a family get together and being 1 of 11 Children to the late Clara Alice and Arther Barnes these would be well attended. Although Jimmy didnt have much to say at times Christmas Triv wont be the same without his words of wisdom and theories.

We will be saying our last goodbyes to Jimmy on Monday 1st March 2021 9.40am Accrington Crematorium.

story:
Our lovely mum, Irene, passed away earlier this month.  After losing loved family members with heart problems, mum always supported the British Heart Foundation.  We can think of no worthier charity to raise funds for in her memory. 

All your thoughts, messages and donations are gratefully received. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Mymarathon are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

pageSummary: I am raising for British heart foundation because We lost my dad suddenly to a cardiac arrest.
pageSummaryWhat: I am raising for British heart foundation
pageSummaryWhy: We lost my dad suddenly to a cardiac arrest.
story:
Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target.

Last year we lost my dad suddenly to a cardiac arrest which turned out life upside down. It’s a pain I have felt tremendously and I want to do what ever I can so that others don’t go through the same thing. If we had know about my dads condition earlier we might of been able to get him treatment and in a result be able to spend many more years with him. My dad was only 62 and will miss out on so many milestones of my life and his grandchildren’s. Help me to help others by donation if to this amazing charity.

pageSummary: I am  doing the dechox because I want to help raise more funds to save people.
pageSummaryWhy: I want to help raise more funds to save people.
story:
The pandemic at the moment has taken over the world  and this dechox for the British heart foundation is a great way to show support to other causes that need the help in this hard time. 

I am sure I will have the  willpower  to have 

No chocolate 

No sweets 

No fizzy drinks.

For all of march for 31 days. 

I have done this a few years ago and raised over £100 for this cause and I hope to raise money again to help out. I really hope to be strong for the dechox and not be tempted. 

If you can give even a pound to the British heart foundation would mean a lot.

I will be doing weekly updates also.


Thank you for reading and the support.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Hi all, I’ve decided to try and give up chocolate for 31 days in order to raise some funds for BHF. My Amelia has a congenital heart defect and will at some point in her life require surgical intervention. I know times are hard and I’m most definitely not asking for much but every little bit soon adds up and helps in huge ways. Thank you in advance and trust me, this is the biggest challenge ever for me seeing as I’ve eaten chocolate every day since being pregnant with Amelia 🤦🏼‍♀️😂

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
As a notorious sugar-holic, I'm setting myself a serious challenge to give up ALL chocolate, sweets and fizzy drinks from 1st - 31st March 2021!

Why?  For my own heart health and to support the BHF.  This pandemic is the biggest challenge they've faced in their 60 year history. And it's led to them being forced to make the devastating decision to cut their 2020 research budget in half. 

Despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are STILL the world's biggest killers, so for the sake of our loved ones and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
Kevin and I are once again giving up chocolate for the month of March to raise money for the British Heart Foundation. We take part every year and try to support them as much as possible. 

This is a charity that is very close to my heart. Both my Grandad Marshall and Grandad Taylor had heart bypass surgery. My lovely Grandma had a pacemaker fitted too. But for the amazing research into the Heart carried out or funded by charities like the British Heart Foundation these life saving operations would not be possible. 

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
It’s funny how this cause popped up on my Instagram page as a sponsored post after I had some chocolate for breakfast...I think that was a sign!

I’ve never in my 31 years of life given up chocolate for ANYTHING so doing it for 1 whole month is going to be a friggin challenge. It’s all for a good cause and it’s something to get involved in during this lockdown (I also miss being able to fit into my stretchy jeans) so, get involved too! Of course, any donation would be awesome ❤️

P.S - a massive GOOD LUCK to those of you who will be in contact with/around me during the month of March, sorry for my moods in advance 😅

P.P.S - help

Love,

Nital xxx

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am raising money because it’s an incredible cause 💕
story:
It might not sound like a lot, giving up chocolate. But as some of you know I SELL chocolate (linktr.ee/LilysChocolateTreats) and am a self confessed CHOCOHOLIC. I constantly have it around the house... whilst trying to get fitter in myself this is the best first step for me and I’d love to help out an incredible charity at the same time!

I will also be attempting to run/walk 100km in the month of March for this cause.

A message from BHF which details why I am doing my bit to help them...

“The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. 

So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. 

Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most. Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. 

For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.”


Thank you for taking the time to read. And please give all that you can 💕🚫🍫

story:
My Dad passed away in 2015 of heart failure.

During the past year everything has been different for all of us, we have wanted to do something to help , but we are not really sporty people

But no chocolate... thats something we can do and if we can raise money to help people then thats a bonus.

Thank you in advance for supporting us

Xxx

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I will hopefully be giving up chocolate in March because it's a great cause and will be a huge challenge.
pageSummaryWhat: I will hopefully be giving up chocolate in March
pageSummaryWhy: it's a great cause and will be a huge challenge.
story:
Anyone who really knows me and my deepest darkest secrets will know that I've had a real problem with chocolate for many years. It may seem laughable to many at first but I assure you, it's so serious that I've had hypnotherapy for it 3 times to get it out of my life. I simply can't be trusted around it! And in lockdown, I've resorted to spending around £5 a day on the stuff again. That's a lot of chocolate, fat, sugar and cholesterol to put inside one body. So with your support, I'm going to try giving it up in March for the Dechox Challenge. Any little donation you can spare would be so very gratefully appreciated. Wish me luck. 

The pandemic is the biggest challenge British Heart Foundation have faced in their 60 year history. And it's led to them being forced to make the devastating decision to cut their 2020 research budget in half. They've never needed people like us more. Despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - let's do what we can to help fund the science and research needed. 

Thanks in advance and again, wish me luck!!!

pageSummary: I am giving up chocolate for lent this year because What better way to raise money for BHF by dechoxin
pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolate for lent this year
pageSummaryWhy: What better way to raise money for BHF by dechoxin
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation by taking part in Dechox! But this time I'm going to whole way and giving chocolate up for lent. Which many of you who know me well, will know that this is a massive challenge (I love my chocolate)! I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target! It's a very special charity which is close to my family's heart (excuse the pun) so please help me in anyway you can,  to get to my goal! Thank you! ❤

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am raising money because of my personal connection.
story:
In January 2021 I lost my brother to heart disease, he was 52. He joins my sister, who died at age 47 in 2010 and my mum, who died at age 53 in 1987. My parents had five children, three inherited the disease and two didn’t, I am one of the lucky two. 

The BHF do a wonderful job, so much so that my brother received a heart transplant on Christmas Eve 2018 and it was the best Christmas present we could have wished for. He is like a new man and it is lovely to see him so happy and healthy, watching his children growing up. My brother is forever grateful and never misses a chance to thank his anonymous donor.

Money will always be needed for foundations like this one. Please help me to help them.

Thank you.

pageSummary: I am doing a chocolate detox in March because It’s a good cause and I want to give back
pageSummaryWhat: I am doing a chocolate detox in March
pageSummaryWhy: It’s a good cause and I want to give back
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

pageSummary: I am giving up chocolate for 31 days in March
pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolate for 31 days in March
story:
As most of you know, I am the biggest chocoholic so this will be a huge challenge for me. 

A few years a go I gave up chocolate for the whole of February and although I managed it and didn't even eat anything that had 'cocoa' listed in the ingredients, it was difficult. 

Now this year I am going to complete March, adding three more days to the challenge.

Even if it's just £1, any donation would be appreciated.


Thank you chums.

Katie

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
As many of you know I lost my Grandad and best friend due to heart related issues on the 29th September 2018 and would love to raise money to not only hopefully find a cure in the future but as a thank you for everything they did for him when he was very poorly. We are still struggling with the loss of such a great man and I don’t want other families to go through what we have, if my fundraising can help in any way, big or small.

This is my fifth year of doing this and if you know me, you know how much I love chocolate, so it is always a struggle but something I also love completing.

Thank you for your support with my month-long DECHOX! My page donations will be sent direct to the British Heart Foundation in a fast and secure way.

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
If you know me then you will know how much I love chocolate and cakes and biscuits 😏 and I love a nice can of Coke in the evening. So this is going to be a challenge. Also if you know me and my family, you will know that this is a charity that is important to us. Despite everything else that is happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. I know that times are hard so anything you can donate would be wonderful.

Wish me luck, I CAN DO THIS 😁
title: My Dechox Fundraising Page
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
Name: My Dechox Fundraising Page

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!
title: Will's Walk
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
Name: Will's Walk

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

story: I want to do this challenge I’ve had two heart attacks and wish to show my appreciation not eating chocolate is the very least I can do . It will not be easy as I normally smash 3 bars a day at least but if you donate I will not touch it for 31 days please donate it’s for a really good cause close to my own heart without my stent I wouldn’t be alive Thanks to all those who lengthened my life xx

pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolate, cake and fizzy drinks
pageSummaryWhy: It is lent and it’s a good cause to support
story:
From now until April I will be giving up my chocoholic lifestyle to support BHF. 

BHF say: The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

pageSummary: Supporting BHF is close to our hearts because our little boy was born with a heart condition
pageSummaryWhat: Supporting BHF is close to our hearts
pageSummaryWhy: our little boy was born with a heart condition
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

My son was born with Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) Thankfully he has had amazing treatments and support meaning he’s perfectly well but at one week old we were very scared parents with a poorly little boy and had no idea what would happen... we had amazing support from day one and BHF are who make it possible for treatment and support to continue. 

Without the support and research from BHF loved ones like our little man wouldn’t get the amazing and often life saving treatment that they need to help the with heart related illness. 

I’m giving up chocolate for lent not just for the days on this challenge so from today, 17/2/21- 3/4/21, wish me luck and if you can give even £1 I would really appreciate it x 

Thank you

story: As everyone who knows me, know I love chocolate and I would eat chocolate for every meal if I could. So I have signed up to take part in the Dechox again. More than ever The British Heart Foundation needs money to help keep up their research into Vascular Dementia and other health problems. Please donate what ever you can afford and help me go chocolate free for March.

story:
Ok so those who know me are aware of the regular chocolate and sweets that are consumed so I may have bitten off more than I can chew! 

So here we go it’s all for an amazing cause ...watch this space. 

Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

pageSummaryWhat: Cutting sweets & chocolate out for a month

story: As many of you know I lost my brother Olly 5 years ago this March. I have decided to raise money for the British heart foundation in memory of Olly, with it also being 5 years I thought it was a good time. I am going to be knocking sweets 🍭 & chocolate 🍫 on th head for a entire month which I think I’m going to struggle with 🤦🏼‍♀️ But saying that it’s all for a good cause!

story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am doing the ultimate dechox because we all need them!
pageSummaryWhat: I am doing the ultimate dechox
story:
This year I thought I'd give myself a massive challenge, and give up chocolate for the month of March.

Then I saw the option for give up more of my favourite things; sweets and all fizzy drinks. Which you will all know what a challenge this is going to be for me. Then I thought 'why do it just for March?', so for the next 40 days (😭😭😭) bye bye chocolate, sweets, and diet coke, dr pepper, lemonade, etc.

Why am I doing this? To help raise money for the British Heart Foundation. During the last few years I have been suffering from panic attacks which leave me thinking I'm having a heart attack. And I think 'what if people didn't know what to do if I was having one?', 'who is working towards fixing it?'. I've known people that have had heart problems and thanks to people like the BHF, they've lived happy lives.

So help me with my 'what ifs', help me with supporting people to live happier lives, help me be healthier, and it may even rub off on to my children. I know times are tough, but please donate if you can, or just give a shout to keep me motivated when my lack of willpower becomes apparent!

XXX ❤❤❤

story:
British Heart Foundation 

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

Thank you for reading and if you want to join in, sign up with BHF and join our Team Dechox. 

Any donations would be greatly appreciated by BHF and would keep us motivated throughout the challenge ♥️❌🍫

pageSummary: I am going to test my willpower doing the Dechox because it’s important to me on a personal level.
pageSummaryWhat: I am going to test my willpower doing the Dechox
pageSummaryWhy: it’s important to me on a personal level.
story: I have a heart condition called AFib which is not yet 100% curable but a lot of research is done by the British Heart Foundation to try and find solutions to make it easier to live with. I’ve also experienced other family members and friends suffering heart attack which is life changing for those who are lucky enough to survive and devastating for friends and family of those who don’t. I would love to be able to raise some money for this charity which is, pardon the pun, close to my heart ❤️

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. Last year my mum had a mild heart attack and it really frightened me as we have lost my grandparents, auntie and cousin to heart attacks. 2020 saw my mum become a Nannie again to two beautiful little girls and I want my mum to be around to see them grow up and share memories with them. I have a massive sweet tooth and literally just live off sugar, sweets chocolate biscuits and Pepsi max so de-choccin in March is a huge challenge for me and anyone who knows me, knows this will be hard. So aswell as challenging myself and in an attempt to ditch sugar it would be brilliant if I could also raise some Money for such a brilliant charity.The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thank you so much for literally any support and visiting my page x

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.
title: My Dechox Fundraising Page
rememberedPersonSummary.name: Simon  Griffin
Name: My Dechox Fundraising Page

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers.

For anyone that knows me well......you'll know how much of a chocolate addict I am. I absolutely LOVE chocolate......almost as much as my two darling children 😂 so it's fair to say that this will well and truly put me to the test (I live for chocolate 😩). 

So please please please give what you can.....to make my "suffering" worth while. Haha! It's for a very important cause which is close to my heart (excuse the pun 😁) as my lovely Grandad died of a bad heart.

Thanks so much for reading......and hopefully donating 🤩

pageSummary: We are giving up chocolate and sweets because We want to raise awareness for all our families x
pageSummaryWhat: We are giving up chocolate and sweets
pageSummaryWhy: We want to raise awareness for all our families x
story: It has been a stressful time for everyone and over the past 12 months our parents have been so supportive to all the new changes we have faced as well as the girls in the setting but since we are not able to fundraise by joining together we have decided to give up the thing we love most, chocolate. Please support all the girls joining in and please donate to the British heart foundation. .

pageSummary: I am taking part in the 2021 Dechox Challenge because Ive lost family & friends to heart related disease
pageSummaryWhat: I am taking part in the 2021 Dechox Challenge
pageSummaryWhy: Ive lost family & friends to heart related disease
story:
As a self confessed chocoholic, doing this is certainly going to challenge me. I’ve chosen to do the “Sweet Supporter” option to prevent me from just swapping one for the other. That means I won’t have any chocolate or sweets for the whole of March 2021.

I have lost several family members to heart disease.  Also a couple of years ago my husband had a heart attack which resulted in him having 3 stents put in and his consultant informing him that his heart disease is hereditary. 

Lockdown hasn’t helped my chocolate addiction, a day doesn’t go by without me eating chocolate. So  I know that this is definitely going to challenge me but if I can do it, not only for my own health; it will also be worthwhile raising money for the British Heart Foundation.

pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolates, sweets and desserts
story:
The BHF is doing a Choc free March so I thought I'd do a sweet free Lent. NOT 31 DAYS WITHOUT BUT 46!!!!!!

For the last few years I have given up chocolates, sweets, ice cream, biscuits and desserts (basically anything with and sweet taste in) for Lent and  everytime I say I'm not going to do it again.

 As a self diagnosed sugar addict its rather tough. This year I thought I'd try to raise some funds for a charity as the recent pandemic has led to many charity's struggling with funds and helping the people they need to.

If anyone would kindly sponsor me that would be most appreciated. Any amount can make a difference.  

Much Appreciated x

This pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

story:

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am giving up chocolate, sweets and fizzy drinks because I want to raise money and sacrifice for lent.
pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolate, sweets and fizzy drinks
pageSummaryWhy: I want to raise money and sacrifice for lent.
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge the British Heart Foundation has faced in their 60 year history. And it's led to them being forced to make the devastating decision to cut their 2020 research budget in half.  Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help the BHF keep up the pace of progress. Despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. 

That's why this lent I will be dechoxing (giving up chocolate) as well as staying far away from sweets and fizzy drinks. Anyone who knows me, knows I definitely don't run and I definitely love chocolate so if I can't run a marathon, I can give up my biggest love (sorry Jack) of chocolate for 6 weeks (yes I'm ending it early because I need a colin the caterpillar on my birthday). All I'm asking is that you support me in any small way you can. Research needs funding, I think the pandemic has shown us how much we need it!

P.S. Jack will also be tagging along on this endeavour but seeing as I'm doing the admin legwork, this page is all about me but maybe support him too if you'd like.

story:
I am a self confessed chocoholic.  My relationship with Dairy Milk is well known.  I saw this fundraiser and, for me, it's a double benefit; lose my addiction?  a bit of weight and support a wonderful cause. Paul is very sceptical but has agreed to hide any of his in the loft where I can't get it. I AM DETERMINED TO DO THIS WITH HONESTY. 

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers.

pageSummary: I am giving up chocolate for month of March because I want to help raise much needed research funding
pageSummaryWhat: I am giving up chocolate for month of March
pageSummaryWhy: I want to help raise much needed research funding
story: In February 2020, I lost my grandmother to a heart attack. It really shook us all. This year, in her memory, I would like to help raise funding for a very worthy research cause- heart and circulatory diseases. I am giving up chocolate for the month of March and I would love if you could help support me in this cause, whatever you can spare. Let’s end the heartbreak.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

story:
I thought it would be a good idea to help others not as lucky as me. I’ve come through this pandemic healthy,    safe, with my family by my side and generally unaffected. Charities like the British Heart Foundation have really felt the impact, and in turn this will affect those they help. Below are some more details. Please give what you can....

The pandemic is the biggest challenge faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. pageSummary: I am dechoxing because my contributions can help to save lives
pageSummaryWhy: my contributions can help to save lives
story:
For anyone who knows me, knows that I am a compulsive chocoholic,  and I always have been for the majority of my life.  Taking on this challenge will be horrendous for me!  but I thought I might as well give it a go as it’s for a great cause and what better way to do it than to raise some money for the British Heart foundation charity at the same time.

I will be donating all the money I would have spent on chocolate during the month of March, which will be a substantial amount!

Any donations will be hugely appreciated! Thank you all.

The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: 🍫 🍬😅⭐️ because ...How wonderful it is to support this cause 💗
pageSummaryWhy: ...How wonderful it is to support this cause 💗
story:
I can’t believe it... I’m voluntarily giving up chocolate AND sweets! 🍫🍬 😅 For anyone who knows me, they’ll know this is going to be a real challenge!  This cause is close to my heart and it’s a privilege to raise money for this incredible charity. Whether it’s a penny or a pound, I’d be sincerely grateful. This pandemic has hit us all in many different ways and charity’s need us now more than ever! Covid-19 has cut BHF’s research in half. Slowing down now puts even more lives at risk, at a time when hearts need help more than ever. BHF urgently need our support. ❤️

 Thank you for taking the time to read my page. Take care. Ellie x

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.

Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

pageSummary: I am dechoxing for one month because I want more people to survive heart conditions
pageSummaryWhat: I am dechoxing for one month
pageSummaryWhy: I want more people to survive heart conditions
story:
We’ve come a very long way treating heart conditions. A few short years after losing my Dad, science brought us what could have saved him. 

As sad as that made me, that it wasn’t available in his time, I know only too well what young people miss out on when a Dad dies too soon. For that reason we need to keep building on our progress to help other Dads be there for their kids ❤️. 

Please join me in my dechox challenge ❤️

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
Anyone who knows me well knows how much I love my chocolate and Pepsi! I’ve signed up to give up both, so this will be quite the challenge but it’s for a brilliant cause and it’s a great excuse to give up the junk for a whole month!

Heart and circulatory diseases take so many lives, sometimes very suddenly, and it’s nice to think that by taking part in this fundraiser I can help support the British Heart Foundation to continue researching new ways to keep our loved ones with us for longer.   

Any contributions my lovely friends and family would like to make will be greatly appreciated! 







The pandemic is the biggest challenge we've faced in our 60 year history. And it's led to us being forced to make the devastating decision to cut our 2020 research budget in half. So the truth is, we've never needed people like you more. Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to help us keep up the pace of progress. Your willpower will be funnelled into ground-breaking science and support for the people who need us most.Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents and friends - we can't drop the ball now.

story: So just before the pandemic hit the UK last year I lost not only my mum but my best friend to heart failure, 2020 was the hardest year I have faced missing my mum and working through a global pandemic so when I seen this advertised on fb I thought it would a lovely idea to raise money for the British Heart Foundation in my mum's memory, I am not going to lie this is going to be tough going 31days without chocolate but I have the support of my family to get me through it so please dig deep and give what you can.

pageSummary: Leah and I are raising money because In memory of my dad who passed away in may 2020
pageSummaryWhat: Leah and I are raising money
pageSummaryWhy: In memory of my dad who passed away in may 2020
story: Leah & I would like to raise money for the British heart foundation in memory of my dad & her Grandad who sadly passed away in May 2020 of heart failure . Dad fought for years with a poorly heart starting with Angina then having to get a triple bypass in his forties. Oxford hospital were amazing with him. He carried on having check ups at the heart centre at NGH. Then things took a turn when dad went for a knee op and he had a massive heart attack resulting in us losing him quite a few times. He was strong and fought it each time. He stayed in ICU then moved to the ward where his heart just kept stopping. The nurses & doctors were amazing with dad and us as a family. They transferred him to Oxford again where they monitored him and decided that they were going to do another bypass. The day before his op they found an aortic aneurysm, it was  to dangerous to operate. All they could do was fit dad with an defibrillator/pacemaker. A few years later dad was diagnosed with heart failure. There was nothing anyone could do!  Dad was a fighter until 2019 where he started to get sicker and was in and out of hospital. finally he took his last breath on 15th May 2020. Myself & my daughter are doing this not only for my dad , but all the doctors & nurses for the care and support that they gave dad and us as a family. Every penny raised will go into helping someone else and my dad was all about that helping others. ❤️

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
pageSummary: I am raising money because it’s a cause close to our hearts
pageSummaryWhy: it’s a cause close to our hearts
story:
Thanks for visiting our page. We’re raising money for the British Heart Foundation and we’d be so grateful for your support. 

Sophia was born on 2/2/21 ... the day Captain Tom Moore died. I can’t help but think that their souls may have met that day and perhaps he passed the baton on ... 

I have been overwhelmed with the love and kind words since making Sophia’s arrival known to the world. The flowers and gifts we have already been given have been graciously received but it has been hard to accept at times as I’ve not received this amount of love in a long time! 

If you were thinking of sending flowers or gifts we would ask you to redirect your giving to the British Heart Foundation!

We are also planning to do our bit too! We are aiming to get out and go for a walk everyday ( weather permitting ) and do at least a mile at a time. Baby steps! ( Pun intended! )

I am currently suffering with a bad back but the walking is helping, both physically and mentally!  

My pregnancy was high risk, and I needed to be monitored weekly for the last three months. I have an issue with my blood ( after life saving surgery 15 years ago ) that meant Sophia might not have made it ... and we didn’t know she was ok until 32 weeks along. She was also measuring small due to IUGR and the stress involved was immense, especially since I have been on this journey as a single / solo parent from the beginning. 

Even though the NHS would be the obvious choice for our fundraising efforts to go to, Captain Tom raised sooo much for the NHS that we have chosen a different cause close to our hearts ( yes, there I go again! ) 

A dear friend of ours had open heart surgery last year during the first round of lockdown and we are so glad she is still here, happy and healthy.

Sadly we also know of a family friend who lost their life shortly after giving birth to her son, whilst on the heart transplant list. 

Tom managed to achieve an amazing accolade in his last year of life and we’d like to see how much we can raise in Sophia’s first.

We hope the money we raise can be enough to help save at least one life. 

Thank you in advance for your donations ... we will keep you updated with our progress.


Charlotte, Murray and Sophia x
title: Sophia Aurelia Elenora Middletons Birthday

charity.description: The ability to get around is vital in order to live a full life yet thousands of people with sight loss never leave home alone. We empower visually impaired people to do that and rely on the support of the public to fund the guide dog service.
charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
eventName: Banbury & Bicester Guide Dogs Virtual Collection
story:
Welcome to our online bucket collection! 

We are missing seeing everyone at our regular collections and can’t
wait to be out in the community as soon as it is safe to do so. We want to extend our thanks to everyone working hard to support the people of Banbury and Bicester during this difficult time and we hope to see you all soon.

We appreciate that times are really difficult at the moment, however we need support from the general public now more than ever before to make sure Guide Dogs can continue to provide our life-changing services.

It has never been more important to come together online and support one another. For people with sight loss, social isolation can be their every day. 

If you would like to help us by donating to our virtual collection bucket or by sharing our page we would be really grateful.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
story:
As a result of the latest developments, we are unable to go ahead with thousands of collections planned across the UK in the coming months. Guide Dogs remains committed to supporting people with sight loss across the UK.

It has never been more important to come together online and support one another. We appreciate times are difficult right now, but for people with sight loss, social isolation can be their every day. 

By hosting a virtual collection for Guide Dogs, every pound you or your group raises will ensure we can continue to help people with sight loss and feel less alone, now and in the future. It costs £13 a day to support each of our life changing dogs.

charity.description: The ability to get around is vital in order to live a full life yet thousands of people with sight loss never leave home alone. We empower visually impaired people to do that and rely on the support of the public to fund the guide dog service.
charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
story:
Almost two million people in the UK are living with sight loss that has a significant impact on their daily lives. Of those, around 180,000 rarely leave their homes alone and lead lonely, isolated lives. 

Guide Dogs works for a world where people with sight loss are never left out of life, for a world where being blind or partially sighted is not what defines you. A world with enough support to make the challenges of sight loss no barrier to fulfilling hopes and dreams.

charity.description: The ability to get around is vital in order to live a full life yet thousands of people with sight loss never leave home alone. We empower visually impaired people to do that and rely on the support of the public to fund the guide dog service.
charity.name: Guide Dogs
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 209617 and Scotland SC038979
story:
In the UK today, almost two million people are living with sight loss and of those, around 180,000 rarely leave their homes alone. Many suffer from depression and struggle with feelings of isolation.

Guide Dogs is here to help solve this problem. We provide individual support that overcomes the emotional and physical challenges faced by people living with sight loss.

We work for a world where people with sight loss are never left out of life. We work for a world where blind people no longer feel invisible, where the quality of their eye sight is genuinely the only difference between them and the rest of society.

A world with enough support to make the challenges of sight loss no barrier to fulfilling your needs and dreams. A world where being blind or partially sighted isn't what defines you.

pageSummary: On the 6th April, we are walking a marathon
pageSummaryWhat: On the 6th April, we are walking a marathon
story:
On the 6th April, we are walking a marathon (40km!!!) to raise money for the Great Ormond Street Covid 19 Appeal. Everyday 619 children visit the hospital under extraordinary circumstances. Infection control means only one carer per child, who must comfort them through treatment by people in masks and protective clothing, and they must organise travel and accommodation under the same lockdown rules as the rest of us.

Any donations will make a difference to patients, carers and the NHS staff at GOSH. Thank you for taking the time to visit our fundraising page.

story:
Charities rely heavily on people raising sponsorship to enter special events. With so many events being cancelled over the last several months, charity donation levels are down.

Because of this, I wanted to ask my friends and family to help me raise some money for this fantastic charity supporting children with serious medical conditions.

The event itself has moved to being a virtual half marathon. That means instead of running in London with thousands of others, I will be running a half marathon locally. 

Please support if you can.

Many thanks 

Nick

story: Every day, 619 children and young people from across the UK arrive at GOSH. Every day, doctors and nurses battle the most complex illnesses, and the brightest minds come together to achieve pioneering medical breakthroughs. And every day is a chance for you to make a difference. This extraordinary hospital has always depended on charitable support and everyone in Team GOSH taking on the iconic 2021 London Marathon will be helping to give seriously ill children the chance of a better future. For more information about the work GOSH does and to find out where Team GOSH's fundraising will go visit the website: https://www.gosh.org/what-we-do

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
pageSummary: 20000 because Set your fitness goal (310,000 steps - 10,000 a...
pageSummaryWhy: Set your fitness goal (310,000 steps - 10,000 a...
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.

I cover night sittings in the community of atherstone and surrounding areas .I vist patients with palliative care  needs . I provide comfort reassurance and medical support to families in there time of need over a nine hour night sit . Marie curie is a charity and as im sure you can imagine now more than ever we need you and your donations. Thank you so much

Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
We have set-up this page in memory of our beautiful mum Donna-June Davis who was sadly taken from us way too soon on the 26th January 2021.  She had so much more living to do, but sadly it wasn't to be.

She was fun, amazing & vibrant.  Always a smile & up for a laugh or an adventure.  She lived for her family, all of us, 3 children, 6 grandchildren & 5 great-grandchildren.  She was loved beyond measure.  A rock, a confidant, an inspiration & a backside kicker if it was needed.  We will miss her more than we could ever say.

We as a family would ask if you would like to send flowers please donate to this, one of mum's charities instead.  Due to current restrictions family flowers only are allowed at the funeral.  I'm sure Donna (and all the family) would be really grateful if you would choose to help this very worthy cause instead.

Thank you so much on behalf of Mum & the family. xxx

pageSummary: I am trekking to Everest Base Camp because of the amazing work they do!
pageSummaryWhat: I am trekking to Everest Base Camp
pageSummaryWhy: of the amazing work they do!
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Covid-19 has caused the world to stop but the work that Marie Curie hasn’t in that time. The pandemic has also given me lots of spare time to really analyse what I want from my life. Therefore, I have set myself the challenge of trekking to Everest Base Camp in September 2021 (if Covid-19 permits, if not, it will be September 2022) in order to enable myself to help others by allowing Marie Curie to continue with their amazing work, and provide high quality (free!) nursing to terminally ill people from the comfort of their own homes. 

I would really love it if you could all support me on this journey and either share my fundraising link or donate, even the smallest amount will really go a long way to help so many people!

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate- saving time and cutting costs for the charity. 

I am writing a personal note to appeal to as many people as possible to raise funds for this extremely important cause. 

My local Marie Curie hospice offers the reassurance of specialist care and support, in a friendly and welcoming environment, for people living with a terminal illness and there  loved ones.

I work as a taxi driver and have witnessed first hand countless people who have an overwhelming positive opinion about the facility. For me it was an easy decision to try raising funds for the hospice.

The government raised half the costs to run the hospice and nursing service, the remaining costs are raised through donations to the charity and supporters of the charity like me talking part in events and raising money. Unfortunately at this time, this is proving very challenging. And with your support I would like to help.

The care provided is free for patients and their families and will touch all our lives in one way or another at some point. So please help me raise as much as possible to help Marie Curie continue the wonderful work they do for us.

I am attempting to run the West Highland Way in 24 hours and also climbing Kilimanjaro. I hope with all the hard work and determination I will be putting in to complete these challenges, you will support the cause. Can you please pass this on to as many people as you can. Thank you

Brenda Trapp was for many years a tireless fund raiser for Marie Curie. Please remember her with as generous a donation as you feel able to make.

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

pageSummary: By remembering Joan we're raising funds because they gave Joan the best care she could have had
pageSummaryWhat: By remembering Joan we're raising funds
pageSummaryWhy: they gave Joan the best care she could have had
story:
Passing away at home with her family on the 12th February 2021, Joan’s family would like to express their thanks, messages of support and the memories shared of Joan.

Joan’s funeral will be on the 10th March @ 1.10pm. Attendees to the funeral are sadly limited, if you would
like to attend please call Jane or Sam on 01522 526080 / 07912492220

Joan was known for having a great time and would never say no to a good old party! A proper Joan style ‘knees up’ will be planned when we are able to get together.

We welcome donations to Marie Curie Night Sitters. It was this service that allowed Joan to sleep pain free knowing a caring face was there when she needed them.

charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
The Great Daffodil Appeal means even more this year than previous years. Marie Curie nurses have been on the front line of the pandemic providing vital care for dying people and their loved ones, but at the same time, they have been unable to fundraise as normal.

So just as they're more needed than ever, they urgently need donations to help them carry out their vital work.

£20 can pay for one hour of vital nursng care for someone living with a terminal illness in the comfort of their own home.

£90 can pay for half and evening's care in a person's home when they need it most

£180 can pay for nine hours of nursing support in someone's home through the night, bringing expert care and comfort families need.

charity.name: Marie Curie
pageSummary: I am asking for donations because They support terminal illnesses+terminal cancer
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As many may know my dad passed away on 16th February 2021 he was loved by so many people and he left a special place in so many hearts.

Instead of people spending loads of money on flowers which I have already arranged we thought Marie Curie would benefit hugely from any donations big or small for all the help they provided to us. From start to finish with his 10 month long cancer battle the Marie curie team helped my dad emotionally and physically at all hours of the day and night when we needed. They provided lots of personal support to myself as a full time carer too which made me stronger and more prepared for my dad.

Marie Curie help care for patients with terminal illnesses including terminal cancer towards the end of their lives, they were here within a heart beat whenever I was unsure of anything and they made it completely possible for my dad to peacefully slip away in the place he loves which was his home. 

Any donation means a lot they did so much for us and I simply don’t know how we would have managed without them. Thank you so much ❤️

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

pageSummary: 310000 because Set your fitness goal (310,000 steps - 10,000 a...
pageSummaryWhy: Set your fitness goal (310,000 steps - 10,000 a...
story:
Every day of your life matters from the first to the last. We believe that everyone living with a terminal illness should be able to get the most from the time they have left, however hard that may sometimes feel. 
We'll be here for you and your family when you may feel like no-one else is, to help you cope when you don't know how. Marie Curie Nurses care for you in your home, when you need them most, day or night. Our hospices are at the heart of communities around the UK. And our trained volunteers and advisers are here for you with practical information and support when you don't know what to do next or just need to talk. 
We'll be by your side with care and support every step of the way, bringing light in the darkest hours.
